24EST1004-K Basics of Computer Science and Engineering

About the Course

Course Code: 24EST1004-K
Title: Basics of Computer Science and Engineering
Included in: Freshman Curriculum
Institution: Saintgits College of Engineering (Autonomous)
Semester: 1

This course is designed to introduce students to the fundamentals of computer science and engineering. Topics covered include basic concepts in computer science, hardware components, software, and an overview of the field's applications. The course aims to build a solid foundation for further studies in computer science and engineering.

About Saintgits College of Engineering

Institution Name: Saintgits College of Engineering
Website: saintgits.org

Saintgits College of Engineering is a premier institution known for its commitment to excellence in engineering education. The college offers a range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs designed to equip students with the knowledge and skills required to excel in the rapidly evolving field of engineering. With a focus on innovation, research, and holistic development, Saintgits College of Engineering provides a nurturing environment for students to grow academically and professionally.

About the Author

Name: Justin Mathew
Position: Assistant Professor
Department: Department of Computer Science and Engineering
Institution: Saintgits College of Engineering

Justin Mathew is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Saintgits College of Engineering. With a strong background in computer science and engineering, Justin has been involved in teaching various subjects, including programming and computer fundamentals. His passion for education and commitment to student success drive his efforts in developing engaging and informative course materials.
